articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: The facts about coronavirus: What you need to know
articles.description: Dr. Jon LaPook presents the latest information about the virus and how best to protect yourself and others from COVID-19.

articles.author: Jonathan LaPook
articles.title: The facts about coronavirus: What you need to know
articles.description: Dr. Jon LaPook with the latest information about the virus and how to protect yourself and others
articles.content:
Coronavirus began in China several months ago, and since then, the virus – and fear of it – have been spreading around the world. There is no vaccine for coronavirus yet, but there is a treatment for fear. It's called facts.
And here is a dose of them:
What… [+5053 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Open: This is "Face the Nation," March 1
articles.description: Today on "Face the Nation," the White House scrambles to calm fears as coronavirus claims the life of an American inside the U.S. Plus, with South Carolina behind them, 2020 candidates set their eyes on the Super Tuesday contests.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump's coronavirus response under scrutiny
articles.description: On Sunday, the Trump administration pushed back to the scrutiny about how it has handled the coronavirus outbreak so far. Natalie Brand reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus response defended by Health Secretary Alex Azar
articles.description: A new study suggests coronavirus was spreading undetected in Washington state for six weeks.
articles.content: Health Secretary Alex Azar defended the Trump administration's response to the novel coronavirus, saying his department is "working to keep" the number of new cases "low." Speaking on "Face the Nation" on Sunday, Azar said he is personally involved in examini… [+1501 chars]

articles.title: Former FDA head warns against devoting resources solely to vaccine in coronavirus battle

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Trump addresses nation after first coronavirus death in the U.S.
articles.description: President Trump addressed the nation Saturday after a Washington state man in his 50s became the first person in the U.S. to die from coronavirus. Mr. Trump said there's no reason for panic. Steve Dorsey reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak raises concerns at a Seattle nursing home
articles.description: In the aftermath of the first death from coronavirus, a Seattle-area nursing home is at the center of a state and federal investigation. More than 50 patients and staff members are showing symptoms associated with the virus.  Jonathan Vigliotti reports.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: 3/1: Sanders, Azar, Pompeo
articles.description: This week on "Face the Nation" the White House scrambles to calm fears as coronavirus claims the life of American inside the U.S. Plus, with South Carolina behind them, 2020 candidates set their eyes on the Super Tuesday contests.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Face the Nation: Pompeo, Salvanto, O'Keefe, Gottlieb
articles.description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on polling in Texas and California ahead of Super Tuesday and former FDA Commissioner Dr. Scott Gottlieb warned of "hundreds or low thousands" of coronavirus cases in the U.S.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Azar says he's personally overseeing investigation into HHS whistleblower allegations on coronavirus
articles.description: The secretary of health and human services says he is looking into allegations that health workers weren't properly protected when interacting with Americans returning from China.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Crowds shrink at St. Peter's Square as Italy coronavirus cases surge
articles.description: With Italy's cases surging to nearly 1,700  people, numbers of the faithful were noticeably down at the Pope's address on Sunday. More than 60 countries are now reporting cases, Italy being the hardest hit country outside Asia. Charlie D’Agata reports.
